reviews.text:
Barely any facilities, no step free access, trains prone to delay and cancellations and a footbridge so steep it's awkward to use. The new platform isn't helpful if it's just closed off with no seating and shelter too. Hard to take this station seriously at all.

Oh and a new station building is being built to replace the portacabin. Located further away in a more inconvenient place. Thanks.

Quite possibly the friendliest station I have visited. 
The staff that worked there were extremely helpful even supplied my daughters with bottles of water as it was a very hot day. 
It's unfortunate the trains are every hour but a pleasant experience at the station

Failing Network rail...the source of constantly failing rail signals. Under investment in the countries rail infrastructure has been causing the travelling public pain for years. More funds are available than ever from massive rail fare increases yet Network Rail still choose to under invest in signal technology. Delays cause significant strife to those paying exorbitant fares. The highest fares per mile travelled anywhere in the entire world! The public should demand more from Network Rail who are refusing to replace all substandard signals. What an horrendous record for a rail company to have. Get real!! Up-date 26/2/2019..UK Gov due to take action...possibly..maybe...Just heard that OVER 1000 staff at NETWORK RAIL are PAID OVER £100,000 a year...for WHAT exactly and this EXPLAINS where ALL the money that SHOULD be spent on signal equipment ACTUALLY goes!! This is AN ABSOLUTE SCANDLE!!!
Theale Station has a minimum of facilities. Platform access is via 2 flights of stairs on both sides, there is no disabled access or assistance.

A fairly basic railway station. HSTs pass through daily and quite a lot of goods trains pass through or stop at the industrial sidings next door. Steam trains also pass through approximately once a month and sometimes stop here for water.
